alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 8:59PM EDT until July 08 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following county...Chester. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 PM EDT, the heavy rain had exited the advisory area, but minor flooding still persists. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Phoenixville, Chester Springs, Lionville, Lionville- Marchwood, Glenmoore, Spring City, Exton, and Thorndale. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 307 and 320. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
